briefdescription.para: Root path for external resource.
Document type for external resource.
Data defined properties for different editor widgets.
Data defined property collection.
Will return a wrapper for a given widget.

parameterdescription.para: The widget which was created by a wrapper

simplesect.para: The wrapper for the widget or NULL

briefdescription.para: Returns the editor widget property definitions.
Create a new widget wrapper.

parameterdescription.para: The layer on which the field is
An editor widget. Can be NULL if one should be autogenerated.
A parent widget for this widget wrapper and the created widget.

briefdescription.para: Use this inside your overridden classes to access the configuration.

parameterdescription.para: The configuration option you want to load

simplesect.para: the value assigned to this configuration option

briefdescription.para: Returns the whole config.
Returns information about the context in which this widget is shown.
Returns a reference to the editor widget's property collection, used for data defined overrides.
Returns a reference to the editor widget's property collection, used for data defined overrides.
Returns the vector layer associated with the widget.
Notify this widget, that the containing form is about to save and that any pending changes should be pushed to the edit buffer or they might be lost.
Will set the config of this wrapper to the specified config.
Set the context in which this widget is shown.
Sets the editor widget's property collection, used for data defined overrides.

parameterdescription.para: property collection. Existing properties will be replaced.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the widget has been properly initialized.

detaileddescription.para: This acts as hint for the calling party if this wrapper can be used after initializing it. If it cannot be used this is a hint to the caller that he may try to find another suitable widget type instead.

briefdescription.para: Access the widget managed by this wrapper.
Access the widget managed by this wrapper and cast it to a given type Example: QPushButton* pb = wrapper->widget<QPushButton*>();.

simplesect.para: The widget as template type or NULL, if it cannot be cast to this type.

briefdescription.para: Signal when QgsAttributeEditorContext mContext changed.
This method should create a new widget with the provided parent.

detaileddescription.para: This will only be called if the form did not already provide a widget, so it is not guaranteed to be called! You should not do initialization stuff, which also has to be done for custom editor widgets inside this method. Things like filling comboboxes and assigning other data which will also be used to make widgets on forms created in the QtDesigner usable should be assigned in initWidget().

parameterdescription.para: You should set this parent on the created widget.

briefdescription.para: This method should initialize the editor widget with runtime data.

parameterdescription.para: The widget which will represent this attribute editor in a form.

briefdescription.para: Is used to enable or disable the edit functionality of the managed widget.

detaileddescription.para: By default this will not change the enabled state of the widget

briefdescription.para: Is called, when the value of the widget needs to be changed.

detaileddescription.para: Update the widget representation to reflect the new value.

briefdescription.para: Called when the containing attribute form is about to save.

detaileddescription.para: Use this to push any widget states to the edit buffer.

briefdescription.para: Manages an editor widget Widget and wrapper share the same parent.

detaileddescription.para: A wrapper controls one attribute editor widget and is able to create a default widget or use a pre-existent widget. It is able to set the widget to the value implied by a field of a vector layer, or return the value it currently holds. Every time it is changed it has to emit a valueChanged signal. If it fails to do so, there is no guarantee that the changed status of the widget will be saved.
